title: @Meddler: How is Xin looking as of 6.9?
body: With the removal of such a staple item for him as Devourer was, how has he been holding up? I thought I saw somewhere you guys were thinking of buffing those types of junglers in 6.10 after monitoring their performance in 6.9 and I wanted to see where that stood or if you had any plans.

replies.body: AS favoring junglers are almost all struggling at the moment, Xin included. From the look of it Bloodrazor's undertuned, which is pulling that whole group down. First thing we'll be doing as a result is buffing Bloodrazor, then looking at individual champs like Xin. Might be a few exceptions to that where we buff a champ a bit as well at the same time, Yi especially's looking like we'll probably buff in 6.10 given how hard Devourer/Rageblade changes hit him.
are you going to nerf Kindred more to make up for buffing Bloodrazor since they're not suffering at all from it?
I suspect we'll have to at some point yes, won't be in 6.10 at least though.
how much weaker are you trying to make her? we who play her don't really want her to be weaker or for her win rate to drop to less than 50%
Nice! Next patch I climb freelo! :"D

Thoughts about Zed's current state? I think now would be a great time to discuss it, because despite his banrate, his winrate is actually extremely balanced, and losing QSS as an option against him didn't affect his counterplay much considering the amount of invulnerability in the current meta and many supports in recent years having hard CC. 

It appears that the banrate is out of presumption. Is this something the balance team will address or do you think it would be more wise to just let people figure it out on their own that Zed isn't actually broken right now?

I guess my real question is: Do you think a high banrate justifies nerfing an otherwise balanced champion? I think it's an interesting topic of discussion.

In the context of a buff for Bloodrazor, would it be a possibility to have the passive's damage be able to work with Lifesteal?
It should already. Life steal procs on physical on-hit damage ( and the magical damage from Corki passive ).

Actually, Lifesteal does not proc on physical on-hit damage - at least not on all of it. More info: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/On-hit_effect#Physical_Damage

For instance, in 5.8, BotRK's passive was changed specifically to apply Lifesteal to its on-hit damage.

I am also not sure whether Fervor of Battle applies Lifesteal.
Only possible way to get lifesteal in physical abilities is death's dance. At least for now.

>From the look of it Bloodrazor's undertuned

What makes you guys believe this iteration of Bloodrazor won't end up the same way as the old Bloodrazor - kept bad intentionally, otherwise it would be too good against squishies? Is it just the fact that it's physical damage, making it easier to defend against, allowing it to be a little stronger (but it would still have the problem of killing squishies)? Do you guys believe that the game has "evolved" far enough that such an item can exist in a strong capacity without being considered a problem?

All of that sounds more hostile than I am intending it to be, but I don't know how to reword it right now.

Old Bloodrazor was unintentionally more punishing to squishies compared to tanks due to the fact that it was an item primarily intended for physical damage dealers that dealt magic damage - which meant that it did not synergize with the remainder of the anti-tank itemization accessible to these champions.

New Bloodrazor is physical damage, which should work nicely around this problem. Especially in combination with the fact that current ArPen itemization is geared towards increasing your damage against tanks specifically.

> New Bloodrazor is physical damage, which should work nicely around this problem. Especially in combination with the fact that current ArPen itemization is geared towards increasing your damage against tanks specifically.

Magic resist was and still currently is easier for squishies to get than armor. Mages simply have one of each, but RADs have 0 armor items and 2 MR items, with a third if we consider BV (which I currently don't due to just how utterly and totally bad it is, but it used to be decent for RADs). On top of that, Locket, an item that is very often built, gives AoE MR. 

The only ArP items that are designed to take down tanks are the two Last Whisper items. Every other item with ArP on it hurts squishies a lot more than tanks. Black Cleaver is kind of both, though it's harder to stack against a squishy.

I think it is better to go with the champs because the fact that they all left lane is also showing a reason why they need a buff pretty badly. Not only was every devourer nerfed repeatedly to try and bring them in line, but virtually all of them had their viability in lane completely gutted.

2 things I want to say regarding the recent changes. 

1. Riot nerfed a load of champions because of the guinso + devourer combo on them, THEN you went onto delete devourer + nerf guinso to the ground while leaving the previously nerfed champions in the same situation. I think this patch may of been a little under-planned.

2. The reason Riot removed devourer was supposedly because of the AFK farming by devourer junglers, this may be the case for BAD junglers but I'm sure in platinum+ elo this hardly ever happened. Why? They get the most stacks from dragon + easiest stacks from scuttler, making these highly contested = More fighting/ more involvement in the game rather than just AFK farming. I think the easiest solution would be to bring back devourer then go from there. You changed the whole jungle + dragons + devourer all at once without testing them 1 by 1. Now that dragons are different, these devourer junglers would be contesting it even more and having even more involvement in the game. This would counter your view of them just "afk farming".

I tried a game of Yi with both bloodrazor and warrior enchant. Since the early jungle ganks has increased, Yi is actually scaling better with going Warrior then an AS item. With bloodrazor, Yi has to go rageblade with tiamat for taht AoE dmg. With a win rate of 42% i believe, he went 10% lower in a single patch.

For champions like Xin and Shyvana, can't you just refocus their kits a bit to favor Warrior or Cinderhulk more? AS builds require tankiness in order to go off because of their sustained damage, and that doesn't work well on melee characters. AD burst or tankiness is just more balanced and better to support isn't it?

Shyvana's entire kit scales with AS. To change her so that she'd warrior enchant would require such drastic changes to her kit that she wouldn't even feel like the same character anymore. Meanwhile Cinderhulk is already plenty viable on her as is and always has been, so no changes would be required to make that work for her.

What they should do is buff Wit's End to make it better. The item is already semi-tanky, offering damage while also being able to fill an MR slot for defensive itemization. It just needs to be a better item as a whole and that would help out tanky AS champs.
